full_idea.title: Trail Tales and Syllable Spirits

protagonist.name: Kai Littlefeather
protagonist.background: Native American boy from a tribal community in the Oklahoma plains, raised by his aunt and uncle after losing his parents
protagonist.struggle: Late bloomer with challenges in decoding multisyllabic words, often guessing instead of sounding out

full_idea.contemporary_hook: Eco-drone adventures in 2025, where kids use personal drones for nature exploration and conservation mapping
full_idea.literacy_skill: Decoding multisyllabic words through syllable division
full_idea.creative_integration: Kai's passion for drone-flying nature trails involves reading topographic maps with long place names, breaking them into syllables to program accurate flight paths

setting.primary: Tribal lands in the Oklahoma plains
setting.secondary: Aerial spirit realm viewed through drone cameras

full_idea.character_arc: Kai struggles with reading trail signs, leading to a lost drone and deep frustration; breakthrough via syllable-mapping games with his aunt; masters decoding to recover lost artifacts; teaches tribal youth groups the skill during drone workshops
full_idea.unique_element: The drone captures footage of ancestral spirits who communicate through syllabic echoes in the wind
full_idea.pitch: On the windswept plains of Oklahoma's tribal lands, 9-year-old Kai Littlefeather soars with his eco-drone to map sacred trails, but his late-bloomer struggles with multisyllabic words ground his adventures. When a storm scatters ancient relics, Kai divides syllables like flight paths to decode clues, rising from frustration to mastery and guiding his community in a high-flying quest that preserves their heritage through newfound reading prowess.
